definition: li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
no ivory comes from the mouth of a dog (idiom)/no good words are to be expected from a scoundrel
pinyin: gou3 zui3 li5 tu3 bu4 chu1 xiang4 ya2

sentences.english: What did Chul get in Han's mouth?
sentences.chinese: 希澈从韩庚嘴里拿到了什么？

sentences.english: I will shit in your mouth.
See what they spew from their mouths- they spew out swords from their lips, and they say, 'Who can hear us?'
sentences.chinese: 他们口中喷吐恶言，嘴里有刀，他们说有谁听见。

sentences.english: Dragonsnakes were well armored with razor fins, and had rows of sharp fangs in their mouths.
sentences.chinese: 龙蛇有着锋利的鳍，嘴里长着尖利的毒牙。

sentences.english: I cupped the deers muzzle in my hand and breathed into its hot mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我用手环住鹿的吻部，往它温热的嘴里吹气。

sentences.english: Behold, they belch out with their mouth: swords are in their lips: for who, say they, doth hear?
sentences.chinese: 他们口中喷吐恶言，嘴里有刀，他们说有谁听见。

sentences.english: The nurse forced the food into his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 护士强将食物塞进他嘴里。

sentences.english: You sit crouched in your palanquin and repeat the names of the gods in prayer.
sentences.chinese: 你蹲坐在你的轿子里，嘴里反复地祷念着神的名字。

sentences.english: “Idiot, ” I say, my mouth full of rice.
sentences.chinese: “白痴，”我说，我的嘴里满是米饭。

sentences.english: I quickly scooped up another ravioli and popped it in my mouth.
sentences.chinese: 我飞快地舀起一个馄饨，放进嘴里。

sentences.english: When we want to intubate the patient, he turns out to have dentures in his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 当我们想给他插管时，我们发现他的嘴里装有假牙。

sentences.english: With the petals in your mouth, spring atmosphere pervades mouthful.
sentences.chinese: 将花瓣含在嘴里，让满嘴都是春的气息。

sentences.english: Don't hold the aspirator too far back in the patient's mouth.
sentences.chinese: 不要把吸引器往病人嘴里推得太深。

sentences.english: Choose sitting on that couch watching mind- numbing sprit-crushing game shows, stuffing fucking junk food into your mouth.
sentences.chinese: 选择在沙发上看无聊透顶的节目，往嘴里塞垃圾食物。

sentences.english: Which fish shelters its young in its mouth?
sentences.chinese: 什么鱼把它的“孩子”藏在嘴里？

sentences.english: Poor digestion can be caused by defective mastication of the food in the mouth.
sentences.chinese: 消化不良可能是由于嘴里的食物没有充分咀嚼的缘故。

definition: a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)/(to agree etc) unreservedly
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to hold with one's mouth (as a smoker with a cigarette or a dog with a bone)
